result.execSummary:
The defendant Coleonn M McAfee Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If revoked:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Consecutive to: Case 15CF929, if revoked.
Same Conditions for Extended Supervision apply as to Conditions for Probation, if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with Brookfield Square Mall.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Case 15CM175 is dismissed and read in.

timeConds.notes:
FIRST month to be served as STRAIGHT TIME.
LAST 7 MONTHS to be served non-working hours (Huber) with all standard release conditions.
Defendant to report forthwith.

records.addlTxt:
Order Revoking Huber Privileges.
  Signed by Judge Aprahamian on 4/4/16.
From DOC dated 3/31/16 requesting defendant's Huber be revoked.
From the jail regarding Defendant's compliant behavior at the jail.

Defendant Coleonn M McAfee Brown in court, in custody, with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.   Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    The Court addresses the Defendant's conduct in custody.  Per an email filed by the jail the Defendant has been compliant with his behavior.  The Defendant is granted to the Huber privileges and may be transferred to the Huber Facility forthwith.

The above named defendant's Huber privileges are hereby revoked until further order of the Court.  The Court has scheduled a review hearing for March 4, 2016 @ 9:00 a.m. to review the Defendant's behavior while in custody.  The Court requests that a member of the jail staff attend the hearing and provide information to the Court at the hearing.
Review hearing at 03-04-2016 09:00 am

Defendant Coleonn M McAfee Brown in court, in custody, with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.   Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Attorney Fragoso addresses the Court regarding the Defendant's alleged behavior at the jail.  The State requests the Court revoke the Defendant's Huber privileges. The Court revokes the Defendant's Huber privileges for 60 days and schedules the matter for review in approximately 60 days from January 3, 2016.  The Court requests that Attorney Fragoso represent the Defendant at the next hearing.  The Court requests that a representative from the jail appear at the next hearing.  Review hearing scheduled for March 4, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Review hearing at 01-20-2016 11:00 am
From DOC dated 1/6/16 requesting defendant's Huber privileges be revoked.

Defendant Coleonn M McAfee Brown in court, in custody, with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.   Mary C. Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
